Package com.iontrading.mkv

Class MkvCustomStatsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iontrading.mkv.MkvCustomStatsManager
  • @Keep
@KeepPublicClassMemberNames
public class MkvCustomStatsManager
extends Object
    This class provides a manager for Custom Statistics tables.

    Any application can define its own statistics tables and use them to report non-standard performance indicators to the Daemon Master, to be capture using the Diagnostics product.

    Example of a Custom Application code to define a custom table as extension of the standard components statistics: 

      MkvType customType = new MkvType("CustomType",
              new String[]       { MkvCustomStatsManager.COMPONENTS_KEY_FIELD, "Bandwidth"},
              new MkvFieldType[] { MkvFieldType.STR, MkvFieldType.REAL });
   customType.publish();

  mkv.getCustomStatsManager()
        .createTable("CustomStats", customType, new CustomStatsListener())
        .extendTable(MkvCustomStatsManager.COMPONENTS_TABLE);

 ...

 class CustomStatsListener implements MkvCustomStatsListener
 {
   private MkvSupplyBuilder builder = null;

         public void produceStats(MkvCustomStatsTable table)
         {
                if(builder == null) {
                builder = new MkvSupplyBuilder(table.getType());
                builder.setField(table.getType().getFieldIndex(MkvCustomStatsManager.COMPONENTS_KEY_FIELD),
                                     Mkv.getInstance().getProperties().getComponentName());
                }

        double bandwidth = 0.0; //compute custom statistics value here
                builder.setField(table.getType().getFieldIndex("Bandwidth"), bandwidth);
        table.send(builder.getSupply());
         }
 }
    See Also:
    MkvCustomStatsTable, MkvCustomStatsListener

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Start the reporting thread, at statime interval The thread will resume and walk through all configured tables to collect statistics and report to the Daemon

      • closeAll

        public void closeAll()
        Stop the CustomStatsManager and its reporting thread

      • createTable

        public MkvCustomStatsTable createTable​(String category,
                                       MkvType type,
                                       MkvCustomStatsListener listener)
        This method will initialize a new MkvCustomStatsTable given the category as a mnemonic name. The category of a table identifies the logical statistics group it refers to. Example: "JGE Stats", "DataModel Stats", "CommonMarket Stats".
        Parameters:
        category - The mnemonic name for the new statistics group
        type - The MkvType defining this statistics table
        listener - The listener that will be periodically called to produce the statistics
        Returns:
        The newly created instance of MkvCustomStatsTable

      • getTable

        public MkvCustomStatsTable getTable​(String category)
        This method will return an existing MkvCustomStatsTable given the category as a mnemonic name. The category of a table identifies the logical statistics group it refers to. Example: "JGE Stats", "DataModel Stats", "CommonMarket Stats".
        Parameters:
        category - The mnemonic name for the new statistics group
        Returns:
        The existing instance of MkvCustomStatsTable associated to the specified category, or null if such table has not been created yet
